entry.title: Roseburg town hall set for Wednesday evening
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Four Roseburg city councilors have scheduled a town hall discussion for Wednesday evening.

entry.title: Rose Villa apartments receive $3.2 million
entry.summary: Rose Villa in Roseburg is a recipient of $3.2 million in preservation funds from Oregon Housing and Community Services to keep homes affordable.

entry.title: Lifting dirt and spirits at Camas Valley Fun Days
entry.summary: CAMAS VALLEY — Dust blew as vehicles — ranging from ATVs to bikes to water trucks to highly modified trucks to a drone — gathered to kick off Camas Valley Fun Days.

entry.title: Loomis announces re-election campaign for Clerk
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Dan Loomis announced he will be running for a second term as Douglas County Clerk in the 2024 election.

entry.title: Man arrested for murder of Oakland woman
entry.summary: OAKLAND — A 45-year-old man was arrested Friday for his alleged role in the death of Terry Lea Deane in Oakland.

entry.title: Law enforcement knocks down Milepost 119 fire
entry.summary: Law enforcement knocked down a fire in the center median of Interstate 5, near milepost 119, before firefighters arrived on the scene Friday afternoon.

entry.title: Tyee Ridge Complex evacuations downgraded, command turned over to ODF
entry.summary: The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office downgraded several evacuation notices surrounding the Tyee Ridge Complex fire Friday. As of Saturday, 129 structures were threatened.

entry.title: TYEE RIDGE COMPLEX 46 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 10:30 a.m. The Tyee Ridge Complex is 46 percent contained and listed at 7,847 acres as of Saturday morning. The Oregon Department of Forestry Incident Management Team 3 assumed command of the complex Friday evening. 1,455 people are assigned to the fires. The effective securing of control lines and structure protection of...

entry.title: GOVERNOR ORDERS FLAGS LOWERED TO HALF-STAFF
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 10:00 a.m. On Saturday, Governor Tina Kotek ordered all flags at Oregon public institutions to be flown at half-staff until sunset Monday night in remembrance of the nearly 3,000 civilians and first responders that were killed in the 2001 terrorist attacks. Kotek said, “Today and every day, we must remember and honor...

entry.title: ROSEBURG WOMAN JAILED AFTER ALLEGED TRESPASS INCIDENT
entry.summary: September 9,2023 9:35 a.m. A Roseburg woman was jailed by Roseburg Police after an alleged trespass incident on Thursday. An RPD report said just after 5:30 p.m. officers responded to the 1600 block of West Harvard Avenue where a caller said the suspect was refusing to leave the property. Officers learned that the woman had...

entry.title: JUVENILE DETAINED FOR UNLAWFUL POSSESSION OF MARIJUANA
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 9:25 a.m. Roseburg Police detained a juvenile for unlawful possession of marijuana by a person under the age of 21 on Thursday. entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOLLOWING ALLEGED DISORDERLY CONDUCT
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 9:20 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man following alleged disorderly conduct on Thursday. An RPD report said at 2:50 p.m. officers received multiple calls about the 37-year old walking into traffic in the 300 block of Southeast Pine Street. Officers warned the suspect of disorderly conduct. A few minutes later, officers received...

entry.title: GRANTS PASS MAN JAILED AFTER REPORTED ELUDE INCIDENT
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 8:50 a.m. A Grants Pass man was jailed after a reported elude incident on Friday night. Information from the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office said just after 9:30 p.m. a deputy attempted to stop a motorcycle rider on Interstate Five northbound three miles north of Glendale. entry.title: COTTAGE GROVE MAN JAILED AFTER ALLEGED ASSAULT
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 8:30 a.m. A Cottage Grove man was jailed after an alleged assault late Friday afternoon. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said shortly after 5:00 p.m. dispatchers received a 911 text from a victim stating that a man was beating her and she needed help. Deputies responded to the 400 block of...

entry.title: Umpqua Kennel Club dog show at fairgrounds
entry.summary: The Umpqua Kennel Club began its annual dog show Thursday, bringing dozens of furry friends to the Douglas County Fairgrounds to take part in competitions.

entry.title: Summer Reading Program exceeds expectations
entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library just put the lid on another record-breaking Summer Reading Program.

entry.title: Forest Bridge to hold meeting on active conservation management
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Forest Bridges: The O&C Habitat Project Inc. will host the first in a series of open public meetings on Thursday to share feedback on its Active Conservation management principles and proposals for the O&C lands of Western Oregon.

entry.title: Scott Hendy retires after nearly five decades of veterinary work
entry.summary: When imagining a veterinarian practice, many people think about taking small pets, such as cats or dogs or rabbits, in when they might not be feeling so well. For Dr. Scott Hendy, a veterinarian practice is much more than this.

entry.title: DFPA DEALS WITH MILEPOST 119 FIRE SOUTHBOUND FIRE
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 6:45 a.m. Friday afternoon at approximately 2:00 p.m., crews with the Douglas Forest Protective Association, along with Douglas County Fire District No.2 and the Winston-Dillard Fire District, responded to a 1/100th of an acre fire located in the center median of Interstate Five at the Winston exit near milepost 119. entry.title: Friends of the Umpqua Hiking Club head to Diamond Lake area
entry.summary: Friends of the Umpqua Hiking Club head to Diamond Lake area

entry.title: WASHINGTON COUNTY MAN CHARGED IN OAKLAND AREA HOMICIDE
entry.summary: September 8, 2023 6:20 a.m. A Washington County man has been charged in connection with the murder of an Oakland area woman last month. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said through the course of the investigation, detectives identified 45-year old Dwayne Michael Lauka as a suspect in the death of 78-year old Terry Lea...

entry.title: DOWNGRADES TO TYEE RIDGE COMPLEX EVACUATION NOTICES
entry.summary: September 8, 2023 1:30 p.m. In coordination with fire managers, Douglas County Board of Commissioners and Douglas County Emergency Management, the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office has made a number of downgrades to evacuation notices for residents impacted by the Tyee Ridge Complex. These changes went into effect at 12:00 p.m. Friday. *Level 3 “GO” –...

entry.title: Using vinegar to preserve
entry.summary: What a wonderful time to live in the Umpqua Valley. There is so much produce available fresh from local sources. My biggest complaint is I don’t have more time to preserve all the bountiful food of the season.

entry.title: A great summer activity: BMX racing
entry.summary: DILLARD — Located between the Dillard Store and First Student bus lot is a small dirt track. This track is one of over 300 USA BMX tracks, and home to the Umpqua Valley BMX Club.

entry.title: Housing prices soar, wages not so much, state data shows
entry.summary: Soaring housing prices combined with relatively stagnant wages over the last decade have contributed to a shortage of affordable housing in the county, according to data recently released by Oregon Housing and Community Services.

entry.title: Greater Douglas United Way giving campaign starts with pancakes, donations
entry.summary: A breakfast of pancakes, eggs, bacon and coffee greeted those who arrived early Thursday morning to Splitz Family Grill. Multiple different sized gift baskets were on tables at the front of the room, enticing looks from attendees.

entry.title: Myrtle Creek Grange hosts carnival
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Myrtle Creek Grange is hosting a carnival from 5-8 p.m. Sept. 16 to celebrate 150 years of grange in Oregon.

entry.title: Harvard Avenue storm pipe installation starts Sunday
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — A storm pipe installation project may close lanes and cause delays on a stretch of West Harvard Avenue in Roseburg between 7 p.m. and 7 a.m. starting Sunday.

entry.title: Glendale man arrested for encouraging child sex abuse
entry.summary: GLENDALE — Wayne Picard was arrested Wednesday after law enforcement found several totes of marijuana plants and an image of an underage female in an explicit sexual position, according to court records.

entry.title: Sheriff Hanlin announces re-election run
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Douglas County Sheriff John Hanlin announced Thursday that he will run for re-election for his fifth and final term.

entry.title: National Dance Day on Sept. 16
entry.summary: National Dance Day is Sept. 16 and the Buckeroo Barn, located at 5051 NE Stephens St., Roseburg, is going to celebrate.

entry.title: Sex offender Uriah Strauss moves back to Roseburg
entry.summary: The Roseburg Police Department released a sex offender notification Wednesday notifying residents that level three sex offender Uriah Strauss has moved back to Roseburg.

entry.title: Myrtle Creek Airport hosts breakfast and fly-in
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Myrtle Creek Airport is hosting a pancake breakfast and fly-in from 8-11 a.m. Saturday.

entry.title: Camas Valley Fun Days is back for this weekend
entry.summary: The slogan “No Mud, No Glory,” is about to be tested in Camas Valley on Friday and Saturday for the second time this year.

entry.title: Douglas County Democrats want Winchester Dam taken down
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — The Democratic Party of Douglas County endorsed a resolution at its August central committee meeting calling for the removal of the Winchester Dam.

entry.title: Meals and wheels has emergency shortage
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Friendly Kitchen/Meals on Wheels has an extreme shortage of volunteer drivers.

entry.title: Transient arrest following reported theft
entry.summary: OAKLAND — Deputies from the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office jailed a transient following a reported theft Monday.

entry.title: 'Swifties' to gather Fridays at Fir Grove Park
entry.summary: The vaux swifts are back at the chimney at Fir Grove Park.

entry.title: Mike Mercker new mechanical engineering manager at Con-Vey
entry.summary: Mike Mercker was promoted to the position of mechanical engineering manager at Con-Vey, a provider of innovative material handling solutions and industrial automation.

entry.title: Governor declares drought emergency in Douglas County
entry.summary: Governor Tina Kotek declared a drought in Douglas County on Wednesday before directing state agencies to coordinate and prioritize assistance to the region.

entry.title: Umpqua Valley Youth Orchestra registration open
entry.summary: The Umpqua Valley Youth Orchestra is registering students for the upcoming 2023-2024 season.

entry.title: Sept. 9 commemorate 9 months of alcohol-free pregnancy
entry.summary: Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) Awareness Day was founded Sept. 9, 1999 to remind us that the nine months of pregnancy have the potential to shape the course of a lifetime, for both a developing child and their family.

entry.title: Umpqua Health Alliance accepts applications
entry.summary: Umpqua Health Alliance’s Community Advisory Council is accepting funding applications in support of projects and programs that further the health and wellbeing of Douglas County residents.

entry.title: UACT digs into Einstein
entry.summary: The Umpqua Actors Community Theatre is exploring the nuances of one of the greatest minds of all time in its next production.

entry.title: Community meeting scheduled for Chilcoot, Ridge fires
entry.summary: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST — Northwest Incident Management Team 12 is hosting a virtual meeting at 7:30 p.m. Thursday to update people on the Chilcoot, Ridge, Brice Creek, Dinner and Grizzly Fires.

entry.title: Ford's Pond transforms into family-friendly destination
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Just a few more weeks and then the young, and young at heart, can enjoy the new inclusive playground at Ford's Pond.

entry.title: Run to celebrate recovery
entry.summary: Multiple community organizations have come together to organize a 5K run to celebrate the journey of recovery.

entry.title: CHI Mercy Health announces expansion plans
entry.summary: CHI Mercy Health announced Friday it will upgrade operating rooms, expand the emergency department patient care areas and address other facility needs as part of a $35 million master facilities plan.

entry.title: Man ends up in ICU instead of jail
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Sixto Martinez was admitted to the intensive care unit at Mercy Health Hospital after he had a medical episode during the booking process at the Douglas County Jail.

entry.title: Construction company leaves trail of debt, complaints
entry.summary: An employee for a local construction company that dissolved abruptly this summer, leaving behind a lengthy trail of debt and complaints, is being sued for more than $50,000 for allegedly taking money to remodel two homes but not doing the…

entry.title: Cybernetic Elks engineer enlightening experiences
entry.summary: ELKTON – Elkton Charter School’s robotics team, the Cybernetic Elks, is revving up for a new competition season punctuated by teamwork, innovation and creativity.

entry.title: Vineyard Tour: Taking in the beauty of Douglas County wineries by bike
entry.summary: For some, Labor Day weekend brought rest and vacation. For the Umpqua Velo Club, this weekend brought the annual Vineyard Tour, a time to bike around Douglas County’s endless supply of vineyards and appreciate the beauty of nature.

entry.title: Food inventory numbers drop at local food pantries
entry.summary: Food pantries are recording record lows in food inventory stock.

entry.title: Troy Phelps implicated in deaths of missing women, per his attorney
entry.summary: A Riddle man facing murder charges in the death of a Winston teenager last year has been implicated in the deaths of at least three other women, according to court documents recently filed by the man’s attorneys.
